page.title: 06WESTON PARK
page.content: This large historic house belongs to the Earls of Bradford. It is situated on the A5 between Gailey and Telford. The house was built in 1674 and is partly open to the public. The extensive grounds and parkland attract many thousands of visitors who come to witness Air Displays, Horse Trials, vintage car rallies and the R.A.C. Rally stage or simply to walk and picnic. Children are attracted to the park by an adventure playground and miniature railway. The park has deer grazing and a recently developed butterfly farm is also popular.
